str2: Simeon or Simon. From the same as Simon; Symeon, the name of five Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To lead, show the way; met: I unfold, narrate, declare. From ek and hegeomai; to consider out, i.e. Rehearse, unfold.
According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
First, in the first place, before, formerly. Neuter of protos as adverb; firstly.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To look upon, visit, look out, select.
(a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Probably from etho; a race, i.e. A tribe; specially, a foreign one.
Apparently a primary word; a people.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
